item.title: A resolution expressing support for the designation of the week of September 11 through September 17 as "Patriot Week".

latestAction.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (text: 9/15/2021 CR S6527-6528)

item.title: A resolution expressing support for the designation of the week of September 11 through September 17 as "Patriot Week".

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S4582; text: CR S4581)

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

summary.text: This resolution (1) supports the designation of Patriot Week; and (2) recognizes that each generation should renew the spirit of the nation based on the first principles, historical figures, founding documents, and symbols of the United States.

bill.title: Expressing support for the designation of the week of September 11 through September 17, 2021, as "Patriot Week".

item.title: Expressing support for the designation of the week of September 11 through September 17, 2021, as "Patriot Week".
Expressing support for the designation of the week of September 11 through September 17, 2021, as "Patriot Week".

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
